result.execSummary:
The defendant Wandell Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>40g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Restitution set at zero.
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from 25 % of prison funds, balance to be paid by 1/27/2021; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge, to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 1/27/2021; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 4 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification program.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

records.addlTxt: Order Cencerning Sentence Adjustment, received and filed.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, for review. jbs

Certification of SENTENCING HEARING transcript commencing JANUARY 27, 2015, received and filed. (34 Pages)
Copy of transcript forwarded to:  INSTITUTION
Bail Refund Packet.
Attorney Benjamin Peirce came in today to state that he will not be doing a bail assignment.
Attorney Benjamin Peirce came in today to discuss bail assignment. We instructed him that he needs to have the surety approve any bail assignment and to then have it signed by a notory.

Defendant Wandell Lee in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS/MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 4 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 1/27/2021; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 1/27/2021; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Wandell Lee in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to Court's congested calendar, matter rescheduled for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Surety completed address change on 11/24/14. Updated payable. LJ

Defendant Wandell Lee in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. Court ordered no possession or use of no drugs or dangerous weapons or firearms.
